dc_description_s: This raster dataset has been created using the original data "Pennsylvania conservation gap mammal habitat models" as originated by the Environmental Resources Research Institute of The Pennsylvania State University (see metadata entitled "GAP_Mammals.txt"). Conservation Values were then assigned to species as determined by SmartConservation\xae methodology and combined to create an overall conservation value raster for mammals. The resulting raster was then reclassified into 10 quantiles as follows: Old Value New Value 0 0 2-11 1 12-12 2 13-22 3 23-47 4 48-52 5 53-59 6 60-67 7 68-74 8 75-84 9 85-162 10 Conservation values were determined by experts gathered by Natural Lands Trust through SmartConservation\xae. This data set is one of several that have been combined to create an overall terrestrial resources conservation value raster for the expanded piedmont ecoregion. Therefore the values were determined as a relative rank, comparable in value only to the other input terrestrial resources data. Conservation value ranges from 1 - 10 with 10 being the highest value.
